poem:
**The Green Conduit**

A serpentine artery, unseen,
Bridging the cold North Sea.
From Caledonian tempests,
Through England's veins, it pulses.
Not blood, but wind's whisper,
Stirring turbines to life.
Two million homes lighted,
By a silent green river.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Electricity ‘superhighway’ between Scotland and England to go ahead Great Britain’s energy regulator has given the green light to a £4.3bn low-carbon electricity “superhighway”, which will carry renewable power for 300 miles from north-east Scotland to the north of England. The first phase of the Eastern Green Link subsea power cable, the longest in Great Briain, will have the capacity to transmit enough renewable electricity from Scotland’s windfarms to power 2m homes in England, according". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
